results.idea: Short-term momentum: cross-sectional z-score of 5-day returns
results.description: S1 applied: uses single datafield (but core signal strong). S2 not applicable (datafield scalar). S3 not needed (coverage=1.0). S4: used high userCount field rsk62_5_return (userCount=400). Kept implementation short and <=2 datafields/operators. Confidence set to 0.85 because short-term momentum is robust and rsk62_5_return has high usage.

results.idea: Long-term momentum: z-score of 60-day returns
results.description: S1 small (single field). S2 not applicable. S3 not needed (coverage=1.0). S4 chosen rsk62_1_return (userCount=649) for strong coverage. Respect KEEP_IN_MIND. Confidence 0.86 due to proven long-term momentum and very high data usage.

results.idea: Mean-reversion: negative z-score of 5-day returns
results.description: S1 minimal. S2 not used. S3 not needed. S4: rsk62_5_return high userCount. Implementation compact. Confidence 0.7 as mean-reversion can be noisier intraday.

results.idea: Liquidity-adjusted momentum: 5-day returns scaled by inverse ADV20
results.description: S1 applied: uses returns and liquidity. S2 not applicable. S3 not needed (logadv20_di coverage ~0.906). S4: used rsk62_5_return and rsk62_logadv20_di (both high userCount). Kept <=2 datafields. Confidence 0.82 due to liquidity improving implementation.

results.idea: Momentum minus industry: 20-day returns minus industry 20-day return
results.description: S1 applied: uses instrument return and industry return. S2 not used. S3 not needed (industry fields coverage=1.0). S4: rsk62_1_return and rsk62_industry_1_100_val3 (example industry series have high userCount). Confidence 0.78 because cross-industry relative momentum can add alpha.

results.idea: Short-term reversal vs industry: sign of 5-day underperformance relative to industry
results.description: S1 applied. S2 not needed. S3 not needed. S4 used widely used fields. Keeps operators small. Confidence 0.72 given reversal evidence in short windows.

results.idea: Quality signal: z-score of net income per employee (NIPE)
results.description: S1 single high-quality datafield rsk62_nipe_di (userCount=96). S2 not applicable. S3 not needed (coverage=1.0). S4 applied (high userCount). Confidence 0.8 since NIPE captures profitability per employee.

results.idea: Quality momentum: recent increase in NIPE (ts_delta)
results.description: S1 single field rsk62_nipe_di. S2 not used. S3 not needed. S4 applied. Confidence 0.76 as earnings-related momentum is meaningful but slower.

results.idea: Growth surprise: ts_zscore of eps growth (beta_factor_1_100_growth)
results.description: S1 used growth beta field rsk62_beta_1_100_growth (coverage=1.0, userCount=96). S2 not applicable. S3 not needed. S4 applied. Confidence 0.79 because growth factor historically predictive.

results.idea: Value tilt: negative z-score of book-to-price (beta_pb)
results.description: S1 uses rsk62_beta_1_100_pb (userCount=57). S2 not used. S3 not needed. S4 used. Confidence 0.77 for classic value effect.

results.idea: Low volatility preference: negative beta to risk volatility
results.description: S1 uses rsk62_risk_volatility (userCount=57). S2 not used. S3 not needed. S4 applied. Confidence 0.74: low-vol factor is persistent but crowded.

results.idea: Earnings momentum: ts_ir (information ratio) of SPE (earnings per share) over 90 days
results.description: S1 uses rsk62_risk_spe (coverage=0.9611,userCount=53). S2 not applicable. S3 not required. S4 used. Confidence 0.78 due to earnings momentum effectiveness.

results.idea: Short-term factor push: ts_corr between factor 5-day return and stock 5-day return
results.description: S1 uses ts_corr between rsk62_factor_5_100_val2 and rsk62_5_return. S2 not used. S3 not needed. S4 selected factor field with high userCount. Confidence 0.7 since factor correlations can be transient.

results.idea: Sector rotation: rank stock 20-day return relative to sector expected returns
results.description: S1 uses rsk62_1_return and rsk62_beta_5_100_mtl (sector expected returns momentum). S2 not used. S3 not needed. S4 used high-userCount sector beta. Confidence 0.75 as sector-relative performance often predicts flows.

results.idea: Liquidity breakout: ts_zscore of log(ADV20) change
results.description: S1 uses rsk62_logadv20_di. S2 not used. S3 not required (coverage high). S4 used high userCount for logadv20. Confidence 0.73 as liquidity spikes precede price moves.

results.idea: Risk-adjusted momentum: 20-day returns divided by 20-day volatility
results.description: S1 uses returns and risk stddev. S2 not used. S3 not needed. S4: rsk62_1_return and rsk62_risk_volatility have good usage. Confidence 0.81 for Sharpe-like adjustment.

results.idea: Earnings quality: high NIPE and rising gross margin
results.description: S1 uses rsk62_nipe_di and rsk62_margin_di. S2 not used. S3 not needed. S4 both have good userCount. Confidence 0.78 combining profitability metrics.

results.idea: Momentum confluence: average of several factor 5-day returns (vector avg)
results.description: S1 applied: combine multiple factor return fields via vec_avg on factor retseries. S2 applied: retseries is vector so used vec_avg. S3 not needed (coverage=1.0). S4 chosen factor series with good userCount. Confidence 0.75; diversification of factors improves signal.

results.idea: Industry mean reversion: reverse z-score of industry 5-day return
results.description: S1 single industry field (coverage=1.0). S2 not applicable. S3 not needed. S4 used industry time series with decent userCount. Confidence 0.68 as industry reversals can be weaker.

results.idea: Momentum breakouts: ts_arg_max of 30-day returns (recent high pull)
results.description: S1 uses ts_arg_max on 30-day returns of rsk62_1_return. S2 not applicable. S3 not needed. S4 used high userCount. Confidence 0.7 detecting new highs has predictive power.

results.idea: Volatility contraction breakout: low 30-day volatility then positive return
results.description: S1 uses rsk62_risk_volatility and rsk62_1_return. S2 not used. S3 not necessary. S4 fields high userCount. Confidence 0.73 for contraction-breakout pattern.

results.idea: EPS momentum cross-sectional z-score of SPE 30-day change
results.description: S1 uses rsk62_risk_spe. S2 not used. S3 not needed. S4 applied. Confidence 0.76 because earnings momentum often persists.

results.idea: Momentum skewness: ts_kurtosis of returns to detect tails
results.description: S1 uses ts_kurtosis on rsk62_1_return. S2 not applicable. S3 not needed. S4 used high-usage return field. Confidence 0.65; kurtosis less stable but useful for tail risk.

results.idea: Combine size and momentum: momentum scaled by inverse market cap(beta_logcap)
results.description: S1 uses rsk62_1_return and rsk62_beta_1_100_logcap. S2 not used. S3 not needed. S4 logcap fields high userCount. Confidence 0.8 as small-cap momentum often stronger.

results.idea: Short-term mean reversion when ADV spikes: negative 5-day zscore if ADV increased
results.description: S1 uses rsk62_5_return and rsk62_logadv20_di. S2 not used. S3 not required. S4 both widely used. Confidence 0.72 combining liquidity signal with reversal.

results.idea: Momentum with industry neutralization (group neutralize)
results.description: S1 uses returns and industry group via group_neutralize. S2 not used. S3 not needed. S4 used rsk62_1_return and industry group (implicit). Kept operators minimal. Confidence 0.83 because neutralizing sector reduces crowding.

results.idea: Factor momentum decay: ts_decay_linear on factor 5-day returns
results.description: S1 uses factor return series rsk62_retseries_factor_5_100_val4. S2 applied if vector; here scalar series so ts_decay_linear used. S3 not required. S4 factor series has strong userCount. Confidence 0.7 tuning decay reduces noise.

results.idea: Cross-sectional rank of gross margin improvement
results.description: S1 uses rsk62_margin_di. S2 not applicable. S3 not needed. S4 margin userCount moderate. Confidence 0.71 as margin improvements often lead to stock outperformance.

results.idea: Dividend safety: prefer stocks with stable dividends (count days since last change)
results.description: S1 uses rsk62_dividend_di. S2 not used. S3 not required. S4 dividend field userCount high. Confidence 0.68 for stability preference in income strategies.

results.idea: Factor momentum combined: average recent factor returns (vec_avg on retseries)
results.description: S1 applied multiple factor return series. S2 applied: used vec_avg on retseries vector. S3 not needed. S4 selected widely used factor series. Confidence 0.77 by combining factor momentum.

results.idea: Relative strength vs expected industry beta
results.description: S1 uses ts_returns and industry beta rsk62_beta_5_100_mining (example). S2 not used. S3 applied if coverage low; mining beta coverage high. S4 used strong beta fields. Confidence 0.76 comparing to expected industry returns.

results.idea: Momentum skew: sign(ts_arg_max) to detect leaders rising fastest
results.description: S1 uses ts_arg_max on returns. S2 not used. S3 not necessary. S4 uses rsk62_1_return with high userCount. Confidence 0.69 detecting strong accelerating leaders.

results.idea: Short-term pairwise mean reversion within industry
results.description: S1 uses stock return and industry mean. S2 not applicable. S3 not needed. S4 uses industry series with high coverage. Confidence 0.74 exploiting intra-industry reversion.

results.idea: Momentum filtered by low specific risk (ksrs)
results.description: S1 uses rsk62_5_return and rsk62_1_100_ksrs. S2 not applicable. S3 not needed. S4 both high userCount. Confidence 0.8 as combining momentum with low specific risk improves information ratio.

results.idea: Short-term reversal when information ratio low
results.description: S1 uses ts_ir of returns and reversal. S2 not used. S3 not needed. S4 uses rsk62_1_return. Confidence 0.66; IR low implies recent moves less reliable, so reversal may work.

results.idea: Earnings acceleration: last_diff_value of SPE
results.description: S1 uses last_diff_value on rsk62_risk_spe to pick stocks with recent EPS jumps. S2 not applicable. S3 not required. S4 SPE has solid usage. Confidence 0.77 for earnings jumps.

results.idea: Momentum combined with book-to-price neutralization
results.description: S1 uses momentum and neutralizes by PB via group_neutralize. S2 not used. S3 not needed. S4 PB fields with high usage chosen. Confidence 0.79 neutralization reduces value crowding.

results.description: S1 uses instrument return and industry return. S2 not used. S3 not needed. S4 both fields high coverage. Confidence 0.74 procyclical picks often outperform.

results.idea: Momentum breadth: vec_sum of industry retseries to detect industry-wide moves
results.description: S1 uses vector industry retseries. S2 applied: vec_sum on retseries. S3 not needed. S4 industry series have strong userCount. Confidence 0.71 industry breadth predicts individual stock follow-through.

results.description: S1 uses days_from_last_change on growth_di and attach momentum. S2 not used. S3 not necessary. S4 growth_di has good userCount. Confidence 0.68 event signals are useful but episodic.

results.description: S1 combines rsk62_nipe_di and rsk62_margin_di. S2 not used. S3 not needed. S4 both have decent userCount. Confidence 0.79 combining multiple quality metrics improves robustness.

results.description: S1 uses growth beta and pb. S2 not used. S3 not necessary. S4 both fields high userCount. Confidence 0.75 capturing style rotation.

results.idea: Momentum trimmed by turnover (hump) to reduce churning
results.description: S1 uses hump on momentum signal. S2 not used. S3 not required. S4 main return field high usage. KEEP_IN_MIND: hump reduces turnover. Confidence 0.7 practical trade-off.

results.description: S1 uses ts_quantile of returns. S2 not used. S3 not needed. S4 high usage return. Confidence 0.71 extreme quantiles often mean-revert.

results.description: S1 uses retseries around SPE dates; apply vec_avg. S2 applied since using retseries vector. S3 not applicable. S4 rsk62_retseries_factor_1_100_val3 has good userCount. Confidence 0.75 earnings window strategy.

results.idea: Momentum neutralized by market cap quintile (group_scale)

results.description: S1 uses winsorize to limit outliers in zscore(ts_returns). S2 not used. S3 not needed. S4 rsk62_5_return used. Confidence 0.72 practical risk control.

results.description: S1 uses rsk62_beta_1_100_spe and returns. S2 not used. S3 not needed. S4 beta_spe userCount reasonable. Confidence 0.75 weighting by EPS exposure helps quality.

results.idea: Industry dispersion: high dispersion predicts mean reversion opportunity
results.description: S1 uses vec_range of industry retseries and applies reversal. S2 applied for vec_range. S3 not needed. S4 industry retseries abundant. Confidence 0.7 dispersion often precedes mean reversion.

results.idea: Momentum with ts_scale normalization over time
results.description: S1 uses ts_scale to normalize return over lookback then zscore across cross-section. S2 not used. S3 not needed. S4 rsk62_1_return large userCount. Confidence 0.78 ts_scale stabilizes time-series behavior.

results.idea: Short-term reversal after large negative factor interception combined with low logadv20
results.description: S1 uses factor drop and low adv20; S2 not used. S3 not needed. S4 both fields high usage. Confidence 0.68 combined liquidity & factor shock reversal.

results.idea: Momentum amplified by recent increase in net income per employee
results.description: S1 uses ts_delta NIPE and momentum. S2 not used. S3 not required. S4 NIPE has good userCount. Confidence 0.77 improving NIPE often signals operational leverage.

results.idea: Momentum with group zscore within sector
results.description: S1 uses group_zscore to compute within-sector momentum and then trade. S2 not used. S3 not necessary. S4 group zscore reduces sector bias. Confidence 0.8 sector-relative signals are robust.

results.idea: Short-term reversal after extreme ts_quantile move vs peers
results.description: S1 uses ts_quantile of return and peer group mean. S2 not used. S3 not needed. S4 peer return fields high coverage. Confidence 0.7 peer-relative extremes often mean-revert.

results.idea: Momentum weighted by factor exposure to growth and margin
results.description: S1 uses rsk62_beta_1_100_growth and rsk62_beta_1_100_margin with returns. S2 not used. S3 not necessary. S4 both betas good userCounts. Confidence 0.78 multi-factor weighting increases selectivity.

results.idea: Short-term reversal when industry average return is extreme positive
results.description: S1 uses industry 5-day retseries vec_avg and applies reversal to individual stocks. S2 applied (vec_avg). S3 not required. S4 industry retseries plenty. Confidence 0.69 collective extreme rallies often mean-revert.

results.idea: Momentum with winsorized PB exposure to cap extremes
results.description: S1 uses winsorize on pb exposure before weighting momentum. S2 not used. S3 not necessary. S4 pb fields strong. Confidence 0.74 winsorize reduces valuation extremes.
